title: jDegro ePRO study - relapse detection via ePROs

questions.text: Please enter your User ID
How much did you weight before treatment (in kg)?
How tall are you (in cm)?
How much do you weight (in kg)?
questions.details: If you do not know your current weight, please enter 0.

questions.text: How would you rate your overall health during the past week?
Which symptoms do you currently experience?
questions.details: You can select one or more symptoms from the list below. If you don't have any of the symptoms, please click on „Next“.

questions.text: How would you rate your pain (0-10)?
questions.details: Please rate your pain on a scale of 0 to 10, 0 being no pain at all and 10 being unendurable.

questions.text: Do you have pain in your mouth?
Do you have pain in your jaw?
Do yoh have a painful throat?
Do you use pain-killers?
Do you feel ill?
Do you cough?
How high is your temperature (in °C)?
questions.details: The following measurement types are possible: In the oral cavity (oral, under the tongue), anus (rectal), armpit (axillary) and ear/forehead (digital thermometer). If you do not have a thermometer, enter "0".

questions.text: Do you have chills?

options.text: Image 2: Faint erythema or dry desquamation
Image 3: Moderate to brisk erythema; patchy moist desquamation, mostly confined to skin folds and creases; moderate edema
Image 4: Moist desquamation in areas other than skin folds and creases; bleeding induced by minor trauma or abrasion
Image 5: skin necrosis or ulceration of full thickness dermis; spontaneous bleeding from involved site

Do you have problems swallowing liquids?
Do you have problems swallowing pureed food?

Do you choke when swallowing?

Did you notice blood in your mouth?
Do you have soreness in your mouth?
Do you have a dry mouth?
Do you have sticky saliva?
Do you have problems with your sense of smell?
Do you have problems with your sense of taste?
How often do you have nausea?
What is the severity of your nausea at its worst?
How often do you have to vomit?
What is the severity of your vomiting at its worst?
What is the severity of your fatigue, tiredness, or lack of energy at its worst?
What is the severity of your fatigue, tiredness, or lack of energy at its worst?
Are you hoarse?
What is the severity of your numbness or tingling in your hands or feet at its worst?
What is the severity of ringing in your ears at its worst?
Do you have central venous access (e.g., a central venous catheter (CVC), port catheter, or PICC line)?
Have you noticed redness, swelling, or discharge of pus at or near your central venous line (<= 2cm)?
Do you have a feeding tube?
questions.details: A feeding tube, or percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy (PEG), is an artificial access through the abdominal.

questions.text: Do you have any discomfort at the insertion site of the feeding tube? (Multiple answers possible)
questions.details: If you have no complaints, click "Next".

questions.text: Waren Sie diese Woche körperlich aktiv?
questions.details: Darunter fällt auch Spazierengehen, Haushalt, Gartenarbeit.

questions.text: Haben Sie diese Woche mindestens 75 Minuten anstrengenden Ausdauersport gemacht?
questions.details: Anstrengend bedeutet intensivierte Atmung und höherer Puls, sodass man sich nicht mehr unterhalten kann, wie bei zB bei Joggen, Fußball, Cardio-Training.

questions.text: Haben Sie diese Woche 2 mal oder mehr Kraftsport gemacht?
questions.details: Dazu zählen z.B. Liegestütze, Kniebeugen, schwere Gartenarbeit, anstrengendes Yoga oder Pilates.

questions.text: Haben Sie diese Woche ca. 2,5 Stunden (im Schnitt zusammengenommen ca. >20 Minuten pro Tag) oder mehr eine mind. mäßig anstrengende Tätigkeit ausgeführt?
questions.details: Dazu zählen z.B. schnelles Gehen, schnelles Radfahren, Rasenmähen, Staubsaugen, Gymnastik oder andere Bewegungsformen.

options.text: Mäßig anstrengende Tätigkeit (mindestens 2.5 Stunden in dieser Woche)

questions.text: Wie waren Sie diese Woche körperlich aktiv? (Mehrfachnennung möglich)
questions.details:
Anstrengender Ausdauersport: Intensivierte Atmung und höherer Puls, sodass man sich nicht mehr unterhalten kann, wie bei zB bei Joggen, Fußball, Cardio-Training.

Kraftsport: Liegestütze, Kniebeugen, schwere Gartenarbeit, anstrengendes Yoga oder Pilates

Mäßig anstrengende Tätigkeit: schnelles Gehen, schnelles Radfahren, Rasenmähen, Staubsaugen, Gymnastik oder andere Bewegungsformen.

questions.text: Haben Sie einen Schrittzähler?
Wie viele Schritte sind Sie gestern gegangen?

results.text:
Relapse
Pain

Nutrition
Infection

OnkApp has created your personal risk profile based on your responses which are used for the following recommendations.

This consists of four dimensions, in each of which you have received between 0 and 100 points. A low score means that there is a lower degree of severity, while a high score indicates a higher degree of severity. This information is only intended as a rough guide and is, of course, without guarantee.

The four dimensions are:

1. Relapse: This score increases with the number and severity of symptoms that might be related to cancer relapse. A score of up to 10 is given for a low risk of relapse, up to 50 for moderate risk, and over 50 for a high risk.

2. Pain: This score increases the more severe the pain you report (e.g., pain 2 = 20 points)

3. Nutrition: This score increases if symptoms are present that may negatively affect food intake. Both your weight and the presence of a feeding tube (PEG) are taken into account.

4. Infection: This score increases if your responses indicate the presence of a possible infection and takes into account the presence of foreign surfaces (e.g., central lines or a feeding tube). The scores serve as the basis for further recommendations. Please note that the OnkApp cannot provide any diagnostic services and you should always consult your doctor in case of doubt. The OnkApp serves to document symptoms in order to support patients and physicians in their therapy.

%(v_red)s Cancer relapse

You noticed blood and pain in your mouth.

Your symptoms might be related to cancer relapse.
We recommend to immediately contact your oncologists for a follow-up examination.

%(v_red)s High Risk of Cancer relapse

Your symptoms indicate a high risk of cancer relapse.
While there might be other underlying causes for your symptoms, we recommend that you immediately contact your oncologists for a follow-up examination.

%(v_orange)s High Risk of Cancer relapse

Your symptoms indicate a medium risk of cancer relapse.
While there might be other underlying causes for your symptoms, we recommend that you contact your oncologists for a follow-up examination.

%(v_red)s Severe Pain

You indicate severe pain. Some patients with your response constellation might benefit from an adjustment of pain medication. Please seek advice from your treating physician.

%(v_orange)s Pain

You indicate pronounced pain. Some patients with your response constellation may benefit from an adjustment of pain medication. Please seek advice from your treating physician.

%(v_red)s Catheter associated infection

Some users with your response constellation have a catheter-associated infection. Please consult your treating physician for advice.

%(v_red)s Gastric tube infection

Some users with your response constellation have a gastric tube infection. Please consult your attending physician for advice.

%(v_red)s Problems opening the mouth

You indicate a decreased ability to open the mouth. Some patients with your response constellation may benefit from stretching exercises. Please consult your treating physician for advice.

%(v_orange)s Nausea and vomiting

You report nausea and/or vomiting. Some patients with your constellation of responses may benefit from an adjustment in anti-nausea medication. Please seek advice from your treating physician.

%(v_orange)s Inflammation of the skin

You indicate substantial inflammation of the skin. Some patients with your answer constellation might benefit from intensified skin care. Please seek advice from your attending physician.

%(v_red)s Inflammation of the skin

You indicate substantial inflammation of the skin. Some patients with your answer constellation might benefit from intensified skin care or other treatments. Please seek advice from your attending physician.

%(v_red)s Underweight

Some users with your response constellation are underweight (body mass index <= 17). A good nutritional status can have a positive effect on your therapy. Please consult your attending physician for advice.

%(v_green)s Most patients with your answer constellation have no complications. Please note that the OnkApp cannot provide diagnostic services. In case of doubt, please always contact your attending physician.
